titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the A. P. Watt and Son records, 1861-1971 [bulk 1880-1949]

publicationstmt.publisher: The New York Public Library. Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature.

did.unittitle: A. P. Watt and Son records

repository.corpname: The New York Public Library. Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

did.abstract: This is a synthetic collection consisting of typescripts, manuscripts, correspondence, and legal and financial documents.

bioghist.p: A. P. Watt and Son is a British literary agency. It was founded in 1875 by Alexander Pollock Watt.

custodhist.p: The bulk of the materials were received from the files of A. P. Watt and Son.

scopecontent.p: This is a synthetic collection consisting of typescripts, manuscripts, correspondence, and legal and financial documents. The typescripts and manuscript consist of memoranda and miscellaneous items relating to Marie Corelli, Rudyard Kipling, William Somerset Maugham, and Herbert George Wells. The correspondence consists of letters from the firm, dating from 1879 to 1971, to Wystan Hugh Auden, Marie Corelli, Charles Garvice, Harold Paget, Michael Roberts, Bertha Vyver, H. G. Wells, the publishing firm Doubleday & Co., the literary agency of Field, Roscoe & Co., and others, as well as an undated letter relating to the firm from Sir Arthur Conan Doyle to Meyrick Jones, and letters drafted for A. P. Watt and Son by Sir Henry Rider Haggard, dated 1887. There are letters to A. P. Watt and Son from Maude Adams, J. W. Arrowsmith (Bristol, England), T. Foster Barham, Benn (Ernest) Ltd., Sir Walter Besant, John Buchan, Cassell & Co., Ernest V. Chandler, Marie Corelli, Doubleday, Page & Co., A. C. Doyle, Lady Jean (Leckie) Doyle, Louis Fabulet, Field, Roscoe & Co., William Hooker Gillette, Sir Henry Rider Haggard, William Heinemann Ltd., Edward Jenkins, Caroline (Balestier) Kipling, Rudyard Kipling, James Stanley Little, Low (Sampson) Marston & Co., H. L. Lucoque, Edward Bulwer-Lytton, Maffey & Brennall, W. S. Maugham, A. A. Milne, David Christie Murray, Paget Literary Agency, Paramount Pictures, William Dundas Scott-Moncrieff, Lucienne Southgate, Tillotson & Son, Amy Catherine (Robbins) Wells, H. G. Wells, Marjorie (Craig) Wells, W. B. Yeats, and others, dating from 1878 to 1971.

prefercite.p: [Identification of the item]. The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature, The New York Public Library.

acqinfo.p: This is a synthetic collection, created from materials acquired through gift and purchase from various sources.

processinfo.p: Processed by Staff; Machine-readable finding aid created by Lynn Lobash and Nina Schneider.

userestrict.p: For permission to publish, contact the Curator, The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature.
